Router Management Service

NOTICE:

The namespace prefix http://cisco.com/jnap/ has been deprecated but is still supported. All JNAP clients should switch to the new namespace prefix http://linksys.com/jnap/.

Change History

Revision Date Notes
3.0.0 2019-07-17 Added RouterManagement3 service to indicate the following actions now requires authentication:
  • GetManagementSettings
  • GetManagementSettings2
  • GetRemoteManagementStatus

Services

RouterManagement

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/RouterManagement
This service provides access to a router's management settings.

Service Actions

  • GetManagementSettings
  • GetRemoteManagementStatus
  • SetManagementSettings

RouterManagement2

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/RouterManagement2
This service provides access to a router's management settings.

Service Actions

  • GetManagementSettings2
  • GetRemoteManagementStatus
  • SetManagementSettings2

RouterManagement3

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/RouterManagement3
This service provides access to a router's management settings.

Service Actions

  • GetManagementSettings2
  • GetRemoteManagementStatus
  • SetManagementSettings2

Actions

GetManagementSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetManagementSettings
This service provides access to a router's management settings. This action gets the router's current management settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
canManageUsingHTTP bool no Whether clients on the LAN can manage the router over HTTP.
canManageUsingHTTPS bool no Whether clients on the LAN can manage the router over HTTPS.
canManageWirelessly bool no Whether clients connected wirelessly to the LAN can manage the router.
canManageRemotely bool no Whether clients on the WAN can manage the router.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetManagementSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetManagementSettings"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "canManageUsingHTTP": true,
    "canManageUsingHTTPS": false,
    "canManageWirelessly": true,
    "canManageRemotely": false
  }
}

GetManagementSettings2

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetManagementSettings2
This action gets the router's current management settings. This version includes parameter isManageWirelesslySupported. canManageWirelessly is now optional, and will be output only if isManageWirelesslySupported is true.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
canManageUsingHTTP bool no Whether clients on the LAN can manage the router over HTTP.
canManageUsingHTTPS bool no Whether clients on the LAN can manage the router over HTTPS.
isManageWirelesslySupported bool no Whether the feature to manage the router wirelessly from the LAN is supported.
canManageWirelessly bool yes Whether clients connected wirelessly to the LAN can manage the router. This parameter will only be included if isManageWirelesslySupported is true.
canManageRemotely bool no Whether clients on the WAN can manage the router.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetManagementSettings2Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetManagementSettings2"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "canManageUsingHTTP": true,
    "canManageUsingHTTPS": false,
    "isManageWirelesslySupported": true,
    "canManageWirelessly": true,
    "canManageRemotely": false
  }
}

GetRemoteManagementStatus

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetRemoteManagementStatus
This action gets the router's remote management service status.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
serviceState RemoteManagementServiceState no The current state of the remote management service.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetRemoteManagementStatusResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/GetRemoteManagementStatus"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "serviceState": "Connecting"
  }
}

SetManagementSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/SetManagementSettings
This action sets the router's management settings.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
canManageUsingHTTP bool no Whether clients on the LAN should be able to manage the router over HTTP. If the value of this parameter is false, the value of the canManageUsingHTTPS parameter must be true.
canManageUsingHTTPS bool no Whether clients on the LAN should be able to manage the router over HTTPS. If the value of this parameter is false, the value of the canManageUsingHTTP parameter must be true.
canManageWirelessly bool no Whether clients connected wirelessly to the LAN should be able to manage the router.
canManageRemotely bool no Whether clients should be allowed to manage the router from the WAN. Note that the GetRemoteManagementServiceStatus action should be used to determine if remote management is possible as various issues, such as connection problems, could still prevent remote management.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/SetManagementSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorCannotDisableLocalConfiguration The canManageUsingHTTP and canManageUsingHTTPS parameters were both specified as false, which would disable all ability to manage the router from the LAN.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/SetManagementSettings"

{
  "canManageUsingHTTP": true,
  "canManageUsingHTTPS": false,
  "canManageWirelessly": true,
  "canManageRemotely": false
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetManagementSettings2

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/SetManagementSettings2
This action sets the router's management settings. This version makes canManageWirelessly optional, since the feature is not supported on all platforms.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
canManageUsingHTTP bool no Whether clients on the LAN should be able to manage the router over HTTP. If the value of this parameter is false, the value of the canManageUsingHTTPS parameter must be true.
canManageUsingHTTPS bool no Whether clients on the LAN should be able to manage the router over HTTPS. If the value of this parameter is false, the value of the canManageUsingHTTP parameter must be true.
canManageWirelessly bool yes Whether clients connected wirelessly to the LAN should be able to manage the router.
canManageRemotely bool no Whether clients should be allowed to manage the router from the WAN. Note that the GetRemoteManagementServiceStatus action should be used to determine if remote management is possible as various issues, such as connection problems, could still prevent remote management.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/SetManagementSettings2Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorCannotDisableLocalConfiguration The canManageUsingHTTP and canManageUsingHTTPS parameters were both specified as false, which would disable all ability to manage the router from the LAN.
ErrorManageWirelesslyNotSupported The canManageWirelessly parameter was specified, even though the feature is not supported on the platform
ErrorMissingManageWirelessly The canManageWirelessly parameter was not specified, even though the feature is supported on the platform
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/SetManagementSettings2"

{
  "canManageUsingHTTP": true,
  "canManageUsingHTTPS": false,
  "canManageWirelessly": true,
  "canManageRemotely": false
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

Enumerations

RemoteManagementServiceState

http://linksys.com/jnap/routermanagement/RemoteManagementServiceState
The current state of the router's remote management service.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
AdministrativelyDisabled The remote management service is administratively disabled. This value is returned when the canManageRemotely value of GetManagementSettings is false.
Stopped The remote management service is not running. This value will be returned if the WAN connection is down.
Connecting The remote management service is attempting to connect with the external (cloud) servers.
Connected The remote management service is connected. Remote management is only possible in this state.
